CatDescriptText: Elaine Hall, housewife, Homewood and Howard Stokes, laborer, Third Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 21, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that racket squads eliminate vice and crime?" Mrs. Hall's answer reads: "I don't know too much about racket squad, because I'm not too much interested in vice and crime."  Mr. Stokes' answer reads: "They don't eliminate it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Elaine Hall wearing striped dress and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk with street and buildings in background; Portrait of Howard Stokes wearing textured suit jacket, eyeglasses, and hat, standing on sidewalk with man, woman, and buildings in background
